comment: She is very nice, full of praise, and loves to give good grades, however she is impossible to uderstand and gets frustrated when students appear clueless (which they always are). I would have enjoyed another professor much more.

Saldanha is super chill. Sometimes, she can be a bit difficult to understand but, that's jut because she is mega-intelligent. I feel like maybe she should be teaching graduate level students. I mean, definitely.

She is a very sweet person, but she has a tendency to keep her class in the dark. She would do a terrible job explaining things in class and then would look at us as if we were crazy for not understanding. I feel that I could have defintely taken more from this class had I had taken it with another professor.

Saldanha is a true performer from head to toe. I question whether her choice to become a professor was a last resort type of situation if all else failed, because she isn't a very good one. Her lectures were so unclear and uninteresting -- it was head numbing. But She is an extremely kind, understanding, and worldly woman. Despite, very easy class.

You can tell that she is more than qualified to have the knowledge and insight necessary to teach this course. She is also super kind and patient. I have a huge amount of respect for her. However, she she is a terrible teacher and all her lessons are so ambiguous that my entire class was always left in the dark. Everything was guesswork.

She is very soft spoken and nice but please do not take her. She is very unclear with some things that she teaches. Her methods are very questionable and are very useless in regards to performance studies. Pretty easy class if you do all of the papers and somewhat participate!! DO NOT BUY THE BOOKS! COMPLETE WASTE OF MONEY.

I really did not understand this class. I only took it with her to get it out of the way to take upper level courses. She was fair with grading. I came out with a B. Its also sad that the Theater Students dont respect her and will talk even while she is talking.But anyway I'd say take her & it shouldnt be that hard. But BE ENGAGED THOUGH!!

She is an extremely sweet woman, but is not enthusiastic, interesting, or engaged in the class. no one takes her seriously, which is very sad, but she cuts too much slack and the activities are always less than helpful. Fair grading.

she is very nice, and will work with you. and she is very intelligent. but she shouldn't be a teacher. she cannot really keep an entire class in her control. often times she seems like she is hesitant to take control. the class does not respect her and she doesn't do anything to change that. i really wish i had taken this class with someone else.

i can tell that she knows a lot, the problem is that she doesn't know how to interpret that to even one student. the class was chaotic to say the least. she means well but it is not worth it to sit through the class for even one day. Run the other direction...

Don't do it. Bless her heart, but she is not meant to be a teacher. She is very sweet but there is no structure. The activities were fun but to be honest, each day of class was excruciating. Lectures seemed to have nothing in common, and she doesn't like to listen to her students. If there was a problem, we had to have another teacher point it out.

I am sure that she is a brilliant woman, but she is not a teacher. The class was easy because we never really did anything. The problem was she was so lenient to the point that she had no control. Do not take a class with her! You'll get an A. But you won't learn, and you'll be so board.

This class is a little out-there but it's pretty easy. She's nice, but she won't be very fond of you unless you participate enthusiastically in her less-than-conventional activities. 4 major projects and 4 major essays.
